step1.sentence: She was determined to participate actively in every team meeting, asking questions and sharing ideas without hesitation.

step2.story: During the community workshop, Marcus decided to participate actively instead of sitting quietly in the back row. He raised his hand, offered suggestions, and even volunteered to lead a group discussion. By the end of the session, the facilitator personally thanked him for his energy.

step3.story: Yuna had always been the kind of student who sat near the door and slipped out quickly after class. But when her professor announced a semester-long debate project, she made a decision: she would participate actively this time. She started reading ahead, preparing notes, and raising her hand even when she wasn't completely sure of the answer. The first time she spoke up, her voice shook — but her point was sharp and the class listened. Week by week, her confidence grew, and so did her understanding of the material. By finals, she was the one other students turned to when they wanted to talk through ideas.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 어떤 활동이나 모임에 적극적이고 능동적으로 참여하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 단순히 자리를 채우는 것이 아니라, 의견을 내고 행동으로 기여하는 방식으로 참여할 때 사용한다. 수업, 회의, 커뮤니티 활동 등 다양한 맥락에 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'participate'는 라틴어 'participare(나누어 갖다)'에서 유래했고, 'actively'는 라틴어 'activus(행동하는)'에서 비롯되었다. 함께 쓰이면 '능동적으로 몫을 다하다'라는 뜻이 된다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순 참석(attend)과 달리 주도성과 열의가 담겨 있다. 칭찬이나 권고의 맥락에서 자주 쓰이며, 소극적 태도와 대비되는 긍정적 뉘앙스를 가진다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Students who participate actively in class tend to retain information better.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 수업에 적극적으로 참여하는 학생들은 정보를 더 잘 기억하는 경향이 있다.
